intro: Crotalaria ionoptera, commonly known as the yellow crotalaria, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is characterized by its yellow flowers and palmate leaves, which are typically divided into three to five lobes. The plant belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is known for its ability to fix nitrogen in the soil. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed areas such as roadsides and fields. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it can become invasive in certain environments.
